alert.note: Alert for Blanco; Gillespie; Kendall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 7:41AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Blanco, eastern Gillespie and northwestern Kendall Counties through 815 AM CST... At 741 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Old Tunnel State Park, or 12 miles northeast of Comfort, moving north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Round Mountain, Stonewall, Blowout, Luckenbach, Cain City, Sandy, Old Tunnel State Park, Willow City, Rocky Hill, LBJ State Park, Bankersmith, Rocky Creek, Hye, Blumenthal, Eckert, Albert, Grapetown and LBJ National Historical Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
